inclusion.criterion: Diagnosis of acute pancreatitis confirmed by revised Atlanta criteria
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Admitted to the medical floor within 48 hours of emergency department arrival at Beth Israel Deaconess Medical Center (BIDMC) in Boston, Massachusetts.
inclusion.label: met

exclusion.criterion: Direct admission to ICU from emergency department
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: Known chronic pain syndrome or concurrent other medical condition with chronic pain
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: Active encephalopathy/confusion/delirium/psychiatric illness or any other condition that limits capacity
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: Renal insufficiency (baseline Creatinine of >2 and/or acute kidney injury with Creatinine>3 on admission)
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: Known allergy to acetaminophen or hepatic dysfunction otherwise limiting acetaminophen
exclusion.label: unknown

notes: Patient is a 22yo F with systemic mastocytosis, presenting with flushing and tachycardia concerning for another flare. She responded well to IV steroids and diphenydramine.
